intro: Fadogia humilis, commonly known as the dwarf African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and woodland areas. Fadogia humilis is also noted for its potential medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
